title: Did any kpop entertainment allow kpop groups to make there own song or write the lyrics? - Quora

response.answer_text: They actually do allow idols to write lyrics and produce songs. Suga and RM from BTS and Chaeyoung from TWICE are big examples. Being able to write lyrics or produce songs and sing or rap is a big advantage for trainees. I think you can write the whole song but I also think you will get help from the fellow producers. Suga did produce ‘8’ which was a collaboration with IU and Chaeyoung wrote the lyrics of “Strawberry” along with Kim Eun Soo. Every member except Tzuyu had written lyrics for TWICE. ... Chaeyoung has written the most lyrics out of all the TWICE members — a whopping seven songs  That’s my girl

I think almost all companies allow that. The companies that I'm sure of are — JYP, BIGHIT, CRECKER, CUBE (I said that for (g)-idle only…idk about others) I'm sure there are more companies to do that. But these are the ones that I'm sure of. YG also allows, I think… Hope this helped you
